intro: Thibaudia apophysata, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage is lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Thibaudia apophysata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
